alert.note: Alert for Aurora; Bon Homme; Brule; Charles Mix; Clay; Davison; Douglas; Gregory; Hutchinson; Jerauld; Turner; Union; Yankton (South Dakota) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Sioux Falls (Southeastern SD, Southwestern MN, and Northwestern IA)
info.headline: Extreme Fire Danger issued February 08 at 9:49AM MST by NWS Sioux Falls
info.description: .DISCUSSION... Issued at 431 AM CST Tue Feb 8 2022 Very high to extreme fire weather conditions will overspread areas along and west of I-29 later this morning into the afternoon hours, with relative humidity values dropping down into the mid 20s to lower 30s. While these RH values are borderline for normal RFW criteria, given the expected gusts of 40 to 50 mph and our dry fuels dangerous fire weather conditions are expected. Fire weather conditions should improve as we head towards sunset as the boundary layer stabilizes and a temperature inversion sets up. This will allow for RH`s to improve and wind gusts to subside. People are urged to exercise extreme care with respect to outdoor activities that could cause grass fires. Avoid equipment that can cause sparks near dry grass or brush. Do not toss cigarettes on the ground. Report new fires quickly to the nearest fire department or law enforcement office. ...EXTREME FIRE DANGER... The Grassland Fire Danger Index will reach the extreme category this afternoon. Extreme weather conditions and very low moisture content of grasses, and other dry organic material on the ground, indicate that critical burning conditions exist. All fires have the potential to become large and spread quickly, becoming erratic with extreme behavioral characteristics. No outdoor burning should take place. OUTLOOK FOR WEDNESDAY AFTERNOON...The Grassland Fire Danger Index will reach the high category. The grassland fire danger product reflects fire danger for native grasses. It is not intended for cured agricultural crops, nor will it reflect conditions in road ditches which have been mowed.
